intro: Hedera walthamensis, commonly known as Waltham ivy, is a species of climbing plant native to the United Kingdom. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, lobed leaves that are typically heart-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red berries, which are toxic to humans and animals. Hedera walthamensis thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing on walls, trees, and rocky surfaces. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species within its native habitat.
